title: Midterm Part 2
section: do simple math with numbers, addition, subtraction, multiplication, division
text:
do simple math with numbers, addition, subtraction, multiplication, division

# addition(+)
a <- 10
b <- 20
c <- a + b

print(c) 

[1] 30

# subtraction (-)
a <- 10
b <- 20
c <- b - a

print(c) 

[1] 10

# multiplication
a <- 10
b <- 20
c <- a * b

print(c)

[1] 200

# division
a <- 10
b <- 20
c <- b / a

print(c) 

[1] 2

title: Midterm Part 2
section: put numbers into variables, do simple math on the variables
text:
put numbers into variables, do simple math on the variables

a <- 10
b <- 20
c <- 30

d <- e <- f <- 0

d <- a + b + c
e <- a * b * c
f <- e / d

print(d) 

[1] 60

print(e) 

[1] 6000

print(f)

[1] 100

title: Midterm Part 2
section: find the sum of all the integer numbers from 1 to 100
text:
find the sum of all the integer numbers from 1 to 100

# using the (sum) function
total_sum <- sum(1:100)

print(total_sum)

[1] 5050

# using a for loop
total_sum <- 0

for (i in 1:100) {
  total_sum <- total_sum + i
}

print(total_sum)

[1] 5050

title: Midterm Part 2
section: write your own functions to give descriptive statistics for a vector variable storing multiple numbers. Write functions for the following without using R intrinsics: mean, mode, median, range, standard deviation
text:
write your own functions to give descriptive statistics for a vector variable storing multiple numbers. Write functions for the following without using R intrinsics: mean, mode, median, range, standard deviation

## example 1
# mean
my_mean <- function(x) {
  sum(x)/length(x)
}

# mode
my_mode <- function(x) {
  table_x <- table(x)
  names(table_x)[table_x == max(table_x)]
}

# median
my_median <- function(x) {
  n <- length(x)
  if (n %% 2 == 0) {
    median <- (sort(x)[n/2] + sort(x)[n/2 + 1])/2
  } else {
    median <- sort(x)[(n + 1)/2]
  }
  median
}

# range
my_range <- function(x) {
  max(x) - min(x)
}

# standard deviation
my_sd <- function(x) {
  n <- length(x)
  mean_x <- my_mean(x)
  sqrt(sum((x - mean_x)^2)/(n - 1))
}

## example 2 
x <- rnorm(10)

mean_x <- my_mean(x)
mode_x <- my_mode(x)
median_x <- my_median(x)
range_x <- my_range(x)
sd_x <- my_sd(x)

print(mean_x)

[1] 0.8561326

print(mode_x)

 [1] "-1.5638899693212"   "-0.512128035979204" "0.266670602476026" 
 [4] "0.718449597576394"  "0.753761665464266"  "1.17639548926585"  
 [7] "1.44025771537439"   "1.83949996991032"   "2.09498024835513"  
[10] "2.34732860067887"  

print(median_x)

[1] 0.9650786

print(range_x)

[1] 3.911219

print(sd_x)

[1] 1.214484

title: Midterm Part 2
section: count the number of characters in a string variable
text:
count the number of characters in a string variable

# using the (nchar) function
my_string <- "Hello, world!"
nchar(my_string)

[1] 13

# using the (strsplit) function
a <- "adskfjhkadsjfh"
strsplit(a,split="")

[[1]]
 [1] "a" "d" "s" "k" "f" "j" "h" "k" "a" "d" "s" "j" "f" "h"

#> [[1]]
#>  [1] "a" "d" "s" "k" "f" "j" "h" "k" "a" "d" "s" "j" "f" "h"

b <-strsplit(a,split="")
b[[1]] # access all elements in list 1

 [1] "a" "d" "s" "k" "f" "j" "h" "k" "a" "d" "s" "j" "f" "h"

#>  [1] "a" "d" "s" "k" "f" "j" "h" "k" "a" "d" "s" "j" "f" "h"
b[[1]][1] # access first element of list 1

[1] "a"

#> [1] "a"

# lists can be unlisted
d <- unlist(strsplit(a,split=""))
d  # all elements in character vector

 [1] "a" "d" "s" "k" "f" "j" "h" "k" "a" "d" "s" "j" "f" "h"

#>  [1] "a" "d" "s" "k" "f" "j" "h" "k" "a" "d" "s" "j" "f" "h"
d[1] #first element

[1] "a"

#> [1] "a"

title: Midterm Part 2
section: count the number of words in a string variable
text:
count the number of words in a string variable

# using the strsplit function
a <- "this is a sentence"
strsplit(a,split=" ") # use a space as the splitting character

[[1]]
[1] "this"     "is"       "a"        "sentence"

#> [[1]]
#> [1] "this"     "is"       "a"        "sentence"

title: Midterm Part 2
section: count the number of times a specific character occurs in a string variable
text:
count the number of times a specific character occurs in a string variable

# using the table function
a <- c(1,3,2,3,2,3,2,3,4,5,4,3,4,3,4,5,6,7)

table(a)

a
1 2 3 4 5 6 7 
1 3 6 4 2 1 1 

#using the my_string function
my_string <- "This is a string with some a's in it."
count_a <- 0
for (i in 1:nchar(my_string)) {
  if (substr(my_string, i, i) == "a") {
    count_a <- count_a + 1
  }
}
count_a

[1] 2

title: Midterm Part 2
section: do a logical test to see if one word is found within the text of another string variable
text:
do a logical test to see if one word is found within the text of another string variable

# using the test_sentence function
test_word <- "hello"
test_sentence <-"is the word hello in this sentence"

# using the (%in%) function
a <- c(1,2,3,4,5)
b <- 5
d <- 8

b%in%a

[1] TRUE

d%in%a

[1] FALSE

put the current computer time in milliseconds into a variable

current_time <- Sys.time()
current_time_milliseconds <- as.numeric(current_time) * 1000

title: Midterm Part 2
section: measure how long a piece of code takes to run by measuring the time before the code is run, and after the code is run, and taking the difference to find the total time
text:
measure how long a piece of code takes to run by measuring the time before the code is run, and after the code is run, and taking the difference to find the total time

start_time <- Sys.time()

for(i in 1:100000){
  sqrt(i)
}

end_time <- Sys.time()

total_time <- end_time - start_time
total_time

Time difference of 0.007119894 secs

title: Midterm Part 2
section: output any matrix to a txt file using commas or tabs to separate column values, and new lines to separate row values
text:
output any matrix to a txt file using commas or tabs to separate column values, and new lines to separate row values

m <- matrix(1:12, nrow = 3, ncol = 4)

write.csv(m, file = "matrix.csv", row.names = FALSE)

write.table(m, file = "matrix.txt", sep = "\t", row.names = FALSE)
